name: Precious Paths
heading: Season

bonuses.text: One additional Special Trade per day
Increased Stardust for the first catch of the day
Increased friendship bonus damage dealt by Pokémon in raids

masterwork: For US$7.99 (or the equivalent pricing tier in your local currency), Trainers will receive a Special Research granting a Master Ball as one of the rewards.
Receiving a rare and powerful Master Ball is a special occasion—think wisely about how you’ll use it, and keep a lookout for future opportunities in Pokémon GO to acquire more!

goBattleLeague: The GO Battle League returns as part of Precious Paths! Get your Pokémon ready to battle in competitions such as the Holiday Cup, Sunshine Cup, Love Cup, and more! Visit the GO Battle League web page for the schedule and more info!

name: GO Pass: February
heading: Go Pass

weekly.task: Use 20 Berries to help catch Pokémon

description: Trainers will automatically receive GO Pass: February on Tuesday, February 3, at 10:00 a.m. local time. You can collect GO Points and rank up to get additional rewards through Tuesday, March 3, at 10:00 a.m. local time.

bonuses.text: Increased chance to get Lucky Pokémon in trades
Increased chance to become Lucky Friends
PokéStops may turn gold without a Golden Lure Module
Increased chance to encounter Shiny Blitzle, Shiny Darumaka, and Shiny Gimmighoul

paragraphs: Event-themed Field Research tasks will be available.
Complete Field Research tasks to earn encounters with event-themed Pokémon.
Paid Timed Research
For US$1.99 (or the equivalent pricing tier in your local currency), you’ll be able to access event-exclusive Timed Research.
Please note that Timed Research expires. The tasks associated with this Timed Research must be completed and their rewards must be claimed before February 21, 2026 at 8 pm local time.
An event-themed Collection Challenge is coming!
Complete a catch-focused Collection Challenge to receive Stardust and an encounter with an event-themed Pokémon.
The Lunar New Year Ultra Ticket Box will be available for US$1.99 (or the equivalent pricing tier in your local currency) and includes both an event ticket and five Ultra Balls at no additional cost!
Check it out soon in the Pokémon GO Web Store!

name: Great League and Love Cup: Great League Edition | Precious Paths
heading: Go Battle League

leagues.name: Great League
rules: Pokémon must be at or below 1,500 CP to enter.

leagues.name: Love Cup Great League Edition
rules: Pokémon must be at or below 1,500 CP to enter.
Only red- or pink-colored Pokémon are eligible.

name: Pokémon GO Tour: Kalos - Tainan 2026
heading: Pokemon Go Tour
exclusiveBonuses: Attendees will receive the following bonuses and rewards anywhere in Tainan during event hours on their ticketed day:
You can make the most of your event day with ticket add-ons! Check out the Raid Lover, Egg-thusiast, and Citywide Gameplay add-ons!
whatsNew: For the first time in Pokémon GO, Trainers will be able to encounter Shiny Diancie! Trainers attending the in-person event in Tainan can gear up for Masterwork Research that will lead to an encounter with Shiny Diancie—and it’s all included in your event ticket!

This Masterwork Research will also be available as a part of the event ticket for Pokémon GO Tour: Kalos – Global. Trainers who attend the Tainan event and purchase a global event ticket will only be able to complete this Masterwork Research once, and they will receive additional event-themed rewards instead.
Trainers who attend Pokémon GO Tour: Kalos – Tainan will be able to encounter some stylish Pikachu wearing Calem’s hat or Serena’s hat. If you’re lucky, you might encounter a Shiny one!
Pokémon GO Tour: Kalos – Tainan attendees will be able to encounter Shiny Honedge, Shiny Hawlucha, and Shiny Klefki for the first time in Pokémon GO—if they’re lucky!
Purchase the Raid Lover or Egg-thusiast ticket add-ons to maximize your bonuses!

The concentration of Mega-Evolved Pokémon at this year’s GO Tour is rising rapidly! Mega Victreebel and Mega Malamar will make their Pokémon GO debuts during Pokémon GO Tour: Kalos! Ticket-holding Trainers at Pokémon GO Tour: Kalos – Tainan will get the first chance to take on these two newly discovered Mega-Evolved Pokémon before they make their global debut the following weekend!

On your ticketed park day at Tainan Metropolitan Park, you’ll have a chance to take on both Mega Victreebel and Mega Malamar. Mega Victreebel and Mega Malamar will also appear throughout Tainan for Trainers to take on during the GO Tour citywide experience!
During Pokémon GO Tour: Kalos – Global, Trainers can take on Mega Raids with Mega Victreebel on February 28 and Mega Malamar on March 1, 2026!
If you’re lucky, you may encounter a Shiny one!

For the first time ever, a new nighttime event experience at Pokémon GO Tour is available as an add-on to your main event ticket. Mega Night is a ticketed evening event taking place after the main daytime Pokémon GO Tour event. Look forward to unique gameplay, special entertainment, and more during this “after hours” extravaganza!
Learn more:Mega Night at Pokémon GO Tour: Kalos – Tainan
sales: This GO Pass is available for ticket-holding Trainers. Earn GO Points by completing Pass Tasks to increase your rank and unlock rewards. You can earn points by:
It takes 10 points to advance each rank. This GO Pass features 60 ranks.
Winning a raid: 20 PTS
Hatching an Egg: 5 PTS
Catching a Pokémon: 1 PTS

Ticket-holding Trainers at the in-person Pokémon GO Tour: Kalos events in Los Angeles and Tainan will be able to get Pokémon GO Tour: Kalos–themed stickers from PokéStops and Gifts during event hours from Friday, February 20 through Sunday, February 22, 2026.

During Pokémon GO Tour: Kalos – Global on February 28 and March 1, 2026, all Trainers will be able to get Pokémon GO Tour: Kalos–themed stickers from PokéStops and Gifts between 10:00 a.m. and 6:00 p.m. local time daily. These stickers will also be available in the in-game shop from Friday, February 20, at 9:00 a.m. to Sunday, March 1, at 8:00 p.m. local time.

name: Pokémon GO Tour: Kalos - Los Angeles 2026
heading: Pokemon Go Tour
exclusiveBonuses: Attendees will receive the following bonuses and rewards anywhere in Los Angeles County and Orange County during event hours on their ticketed day:
You can make the most of your event day with ticket add-ons! Check out the Raid Lover, Egg-thusiast, and Citywide Gameplay add-ons!

eventInfo.name: Pokémon GO Tour: Kalos - Los Angeles 2026
eventInfo.location: Rose Bowl Stadium, Los Angeles, United States

whatsNew: For the first time in Pokémon GO, Trainers will be able to encounter Shiny Diancie! Ticket-holding Trainers attending the in-person event in Los Angeles can gear up for Masterwork Research that will lead to an encounter with Shiny Diancie—and it’s all included in your event ticket!

This Masterwork Research will also be available as a part of the event ticket for Pokémon GO Tour: Kalos – Global. Trainers who attend the Los Angeles event and purchase a global event ticket will only be able to complete this Masterwork Research once, and they will receive additional event-themed rewards instead.
Trainers who attend Pokémon GO Tour: Kalos – Los Angeles will be able to encounter some stylish Pikachu wearing Calem’s hat or Serena’s hat. If you’re lucky, you might encounter a Shiny one!
Pokémon GO Tour: Kalos – Los Angeles attendees will be able to encounter Shiny Honedge, Shiny Hawlucha, and Shiny Klefki for the first time in Pokémon GO—if they’re lucky!
Purchase the Raid Lover or Egg-thusiast ticket add-ons and maximize your bonuses!

The concentration of Mega-Evolved Pokémon at this year’s GO Tour is rising rapidly! Mega Victreebel and Mega Malamar will make their Pokémon GO debuts during Pokémon GO Tour: Kalos! Ticket-holding Trainers at Pokémon GO Tour: Kalos – Los Angeles will get the first chance to take on these two newly discovered Mega-Evolved Pokémon before they make their global debut the following weekend!

On your ticketed park day at Rose Bowl Stadium, you’ll have a chance to take on both Mega Victreebel and Mega Malamar. Mega Victreebel and Mega Malamar will also appear throughout Los Angeles and Orange County for Trainers to take on during the GO Tour citywide experience!
During Pokémon GO Tour: Kalos – Global, Trainers can take on Mega Raids with Mega Victreebel on February 28 and Mega Malamar on March 1, 2026!
If you’re lucky, you may encounter a Shiny one!

For the first time ever, we’re excited to offer a new nighttime event experience at Pokémon GO Tour, available to purchase as an add-on to your main event ticket. Mega Night is a ticketed evening event, taking place after the main daytime Pokémon GO Tour event.
Look forward to unique gameplay, special entertainment, and more during this “after hours” extravaganza!
Learn more:Mega Night at Pokémon GO Tour: Kalos – Los Angeles

During Pokémon GO Tour: Kalos – Global on February 28 and March 1, 2026, all Trainers will be able to get Pokémon GO Tour: Kalos–themed stickers from PokéStops and Gifts between 10:00 a.m. and 6:00 p.m. local time daily. These stickers will also be available in the in-game shop from Friday, February 20, at 9:00 a.m. to Sunday, March 1, at 8:00 p.m. local time.

description: White Flower Flabébé, Orange Flower Flabébé, and Yellow Flower Flabébé will appear more frequently on Routes throughout the city during Pokémon GO Tour: Kalos – Los Angeles!
Plus, you can collect Zygarde Cells and encounter Mateo at the end of up to 25 Routes per day!
Please note: No Routes will be accessible at Rose Bowl Stadium or Brookside Golf Course.

name: Meowth, Vulpix, and Alolan Vulpix PokéStop Showcase
heading: Pokestop Showcase
description: There will be PokéStop Showcases featuring Meowth, Vulpix, and Alolan Vulpix. Top the leaderboard to win rewards including Premium Items!Alolan Vulpix and Vulpix are featured in separate Showcases. Any regional variant of Meowth (Kantonian, Alolan, or Galarian) can be entered in the Meowth Showcase.

bonuses.text: The Remote Raid Pass limit will be increased to 30 from Monday, February 23 to Friday, February 27, 2026
There will be no limit on Remote Raids from Saturday, February 28, to Sunday, March 1, 2026

paragraphs: Pikachu wearing Red’s hat, Pikachu wearing Leaf’s hat, Pikachu wearing Ethan’s hat, and Pikachu wearing Lyra’s hat will make their Pokémon GO debuts!

Trainers who take on Raid Bosses during the Road to Kalos event will have a chance of receiving new Special Backgrounds after making a successful catch in all raids. These souvenir backgrounds will appear on the Pokémon’s summary page, showing when the Pokémon was caught and commemorating your adventures leading up to Pokémon GO Tour!
The Road to Kalos event will feature different Special Backgrounds for you to collect every day.
Pikachu wearing Red’s hat and Pikachu wearing Leaf’s hat can have a background inspired by Team Mystic, Team Instinct, or Team Valor.
Articuno can have a background inspired by Team Mystic.
Zapdos can have a background inspired by Team Instinct.
Moltres can have a background inspired by Team Valor.
Pikachu wearing Ethan’s hat and Pikachu wearing Lyra’s hat can have a background inspired by Pokémon Gold Version or Pokémon Silver Version.
Shadow Lugia can have a background inspired by Pokémon Silver Version.
Shadow Ho-Oh can have a background inspired by Pokémon Gold Version.
Pikachu wearing Brendan’s hat and Pikachu wearing May’s bow can have a background inspired by Pokémon Ruby Version or Pokémon Sapphire Version.
Kyogre can have a background inspired by Pokémon Sapphire Version.
Groudon can have a background inspired by Pokémon Ruby Version.

Pikachu wearing Lucas’s hat, Pikachu wearing Dawn’s hat, Pikachu wearing Rei’s cap, and Pikachu wearing Akari’s kerchief can have a background inspired by Pokémon Diamond Version or Pokémon Pearl Version.
Dialga and Origin Forme Dialga can have a background inspired by Pokémon Diamond Version.
Palkia and Origin Forme Palkia can have a background inspired by Pokémon Pearl Version.

Pikachu wearing Hilbert’s hat, Pikachu wearing Hilda’s hat, Pikachu wearing Nate’s visor, Pikachu wearing Rosa’s visor, and Kyurem can have a background inspired by Pokémon Black Version or Pokémon White Version.
Reshiram can have a background inspired by Pokémon Black Version.
Zekrom can have a background inspired by Pokémon White Version.

Plus, when you fuse a Zekrom or Reshiram that has a Special Background with a Kyurem that has a Special Background of the opposite color, the fused Black Kyurem or White Kyurem will have its own variant background!

From Monday, February 23, at 10:00 a.m. to Sunday, March 1, at 6:00 p.m. local time, the GO Pass and the GO Pass Deluxe for Road to Kalos will be available in Pokémon GO!
Learn more about the GO Pass and its exclusive bonuses here!
You may encounter Pokémon originally discovered in the Kanto region, including Bulbasaur, Charmander, and Squirtle. You might even encounter Pikachu, Clefairy, and Meowth!
You may encounter Pokémon originally discovered in the Johto region, including Chikorita, Cyndaquil, and Totodile. You might even encounter Marill, Hoppip, and Teddiursa!
You may encounter Pokémon originally discovered in the Hoenn region, including Treecko, Torchic, and Mudkip. You might even encounter Poochyena, Taillow, and Nincada!
You may encounter Pokémon originally discovered in the Sinnoh region, including Turtwig, Chimchar, and Piplup. You might even encounter Bidoof, Shinx, and Snover!
You may encounter Pokémon originally discovered in the Unova region, including Snivy, Tepig, and Oshawott. You might even encounter Lillipup, Darumaka, and Gothita!
The following Pokémon will hatch from 2 km Eggs.

The following Pokémon will appear in raids. Pokémon appearing in five-star raids will also be featured in a Raid Hour from 6:00 p.m. to 7:00 p.m. local time for one day each on the following schedule.
There will also be a Raid Hour featuring Articuno, Zapdos, and Moltres from 6:00 pm to 7:00 pm local time on February 23.

On Thursday, February 26, the Raid Bosses will alternate each hour during event hours, with the exception of Raid Hour, where they will rotate after the first 30 minutes. Pikachu wearing Lucas’s hat, Pikachu wearing Dawn’s hat, Dialga, and Palkia will appear in raids first, followed by Pikachu wearing Rei’s cap, Pikachu wearing Akari’s kerchief, Origin Forme Dialga, and Origin Forme Palkia. You also may catch an Origin Forme Dialga or Origin Forme Palkia with its featured attack, so you can take advantage of their powerful Adventure Effects!
There will also be a Raid Hour featuring Dialga, Palkia, Origin Forme Dialga, and Origin Forme Palkia from 6:00 pm to 7:00 pm local time on February 26.
There will also be a Raid Hour featuring Dialga, Palkia, Origin Forme Dialga, and Origin Forme Palkia from 6:00 pm to 7:00 pm local time on February 26.
There will also be a Raid Hour featuring Dialga, Palkia, Origin Forme Dialga, and Origin Forme Palkia from 6:00 pm to 7:00 pm local time on February 26.
There will also be a Raid Hour featuring Dialga, Palkia, Origin Forme Dialga, and Origin Forme Palkia from 6:00 pm to 7:00 pm local time on February 26.

On Friday, February 27, the Raid Bosses will alternate each hour during event hours, with the exception of Raid Hour, where they will rotate after the first 30 minutes. Pikachu wearing Hilbert’s hat, Pikachu wearing Hilda’s hat, Reshiram, and Black Kyurem will appear in raids first, followed by Pikachu wearing Nate’s visor, Pikachu wearing Rosa’s visor, Zekrom, and White Kyurem. Take on Black Kyurem and White Kyurem raids to obtain Fusion Energy that can be used to fuse Kyurem into more formidable forms with unique Adventure Effects!
There will also be a Raid Hour featuring Reshiram, Black Kyurem, Zekrom, and White Kyurem from 6:00 pm to 7:00 pm local time on February 27.
There will also be a Raid Hour featuring Reshiram, Black Kyurem, Zekrom, and White Kyurem from 6:00 pm to 7:00 pm local time on February 27.
There will also be a Raid Hour featuring Reshiram, Black Kyurem, Zekrom, and White Kyurem from 6:00 pm to 7:00 pm local time on February 27.
There will also be a Raid Hour featuring Reshiram, Black Kyurem, Zekrom, and White Kyurem from 6:00 pm to 7:00 pm local time on February 27.
New Field Research tasks, themed after each day’s featured region, will be available starting at 12:00 a.m. local time daily.
Complete Field Research tasks to earn Candy and Candy XL for each day’s featured Raid Bosses, plus encounters with different costumed Pikachu.
Note: Pokémon obtained from Field Research won’t have Special Backgrounds.
Timed Research themed after the featured regions will be available starting at 5:00 a.m. local time daily.
Complete the research tasks to earn Candy, TMs, and more items, plus encounters with different costumed Pikachu! New Timed Research will be available each day of the event at 5:00 a.m. local time.
Note: Pokémon obtained from Timed Research won’t have Special Backgrounds.
Please note that Timed Research expires. The tasks associated with each Timed Research must be completed and their rewards must be claimed before 10:00 p.m. local time daily.
When you catch the following Pokémon during the event, they will know the following attacks.
Articuno encountered from raids will know the Charged Attack Hurricane.
Zapdos encountered from raids will know the Fast Attack Thunder Shock.
Moltres encountered from raids will know the Charged Attack Sky Attack.
Kyogre encountered from raids will know the Charged Attack Origin Pulse.
Groudon encountered from raids will know the Charged Attack Precipice Blades.
Origin Forme Dialga encountered from raids will have a chance to know the Charged Attack Roar of Time.
Origin Forme Palkia encountered from raids will have a chance to know the Charged Attack Spacial Rend.
Reshiram encountered from raids will know the Charged Attack Fusion Flare.
Zekrom encountered from raids will know the Charged Attack Fusion Bolt.
Kyurem encountered from raids will have a chance to know the Charged Attack Glaciate.

Ticket-holding Trainers at the in-person Pokémon GO Tour: Kalos events in Los Angeles and Tainan will be able to get Pokémon GO Tour: Kalos–themed stickers from PokéStops and Gifts during event hours from Friday, February 20 through Sunday, February 22, 2026.

During Pokémon GO Tour: Kalos – Global on February 28 and March 1, 2026, all Trainers will be able to get Pokémon GO Tour: Kalos–themed stickers from PokéStops and Gifts between 10:00 a.m. and 6:00 p.m. local time daily. These stickers will also be available in the in-game shop from Friday, February 20, at 9:00 a.m. to Sunday, March 1, at 8:00 p.m. local time.
The following avatar items will be available for purchase in the in-game shop starting Monday, February 23, 2026.

name: GO Pass: Road to Kalos
heading: Go Pass
description: Trainers will automatically receive GO Pass: Road to Kalos at no cost on Monday, February 23, at 10:00 a.m. local time. You can collect GO Points and rank up to get additional rewards through Sunday, March 1, at 6:00 p.m. local time.

name: Great League, Ultra League, and Master League: Mega Edition | Precious Paths
heading: Go Battle League

leagues.name: Great League
rules: Pokémon must be at or below 1,500 CP to enter.

leagues.name: Ultra League
rules: Pokémon must be at or below 2,500 CP to enter.

name: Pokémon GO Tour: Kalos - Global 2026
heading: Pokemon Go Tour
exclusiveBonuses: Ticket holders will receive the following bonuses between 12:00 a.m. and 11:59 p.m. local time on event days.
* Ticket-holding Trainers will have an increased chance to encounter Shiny Pokémon. Shiny Pokémon are not guaranteed by purchasing a ticket.

Central Village.timeInfo: 10:00 a.m. to 11:00 a.m. and 2:00 p.m. to 3:00 p.m. local time

Mountain Manor.timeInfo: 11:00 a.m. to 12:00 p.m. and 3:00 p.m. to 4:00 p.m. local time

Coastal Laboratory.timeInfo: 12:00 p.m. to 1:00 p.m. and 4:00 p.m. to 5:00 p.m. local time

whatsNew: For the first time in Pokémon GO, Trainers will be able to encounter Shiny Diancie! Trainers who purchase a ticket for Pokémon GO Tour: Kalos – Global will receive Masterwork Research that leads to an encounter with Shiny Diancie.

Get ready for new pieces of featured music inspired by Pokémon X and Pokémon Y! This music was composed by Junichi Masuda, Pokémon video game series composer and Chief Creative Fellow of The Pokémon Company! You’ll be able to hear the new music while walking on the map, catching Pokémon, and taking on Xerneas and Yveltal in Raid Battles!
Shiny Diancie will be available with a ticket for Masterwork Research.
sales: Ticket-holding Trainers at the in-person Pokémon GO Tour: Kalos events in Los Angeles and Tainan will be able to get Pokémon GO Tour: Kalos–themed stickers from PokéStops and Gifts during event hours from Friday, February 20 through Sunday, February 22, 2026.

During Pokémon GO Tour: Kalos – Global on February 28 and March 1, 2026, all Trainers will be able to get Pokémon GO Tour: Kalos–themed stickers from PokéStops and Gifts between 10:00 a.m. and 6:00 p.m. local time daily. These stickers will also be available in the in-game shop from Friday, February 20, at 9:00 a.m. to Sunday, March 1, at 8:00 p.m. local time.
The following avatar items will be available for purchase in the in-game shop starting Monday, February 23, 2026.
Xerneas Headwear
Yveltal Coat

The Shiny Diancie T-Shirt will be available as a reward in the new Masterwork Research, included in the Pokémon GO Tour: Kalos – Global event ticket, from the in-game shop from Tuesday, February 24, at 10:00 a.m. to Sunday, March 1, at 6:00 p.m. local time. Masterwork Research does not expire, so you can complete it at your own pace!
Avatar items are also available as rewards in the GO Pass: Road to Kalos!
Free Track:
Premium Track (GO Pass Deluxe):
GO Tour 2026 Tee
Zygarde Jacket avatar item

bonusCategories.timeframe: Ticket holders will receive the following bonuses between 12:00 a.m. and 11:59 p.m. local time on event days.

bonuses.text: Increased chance of encountering Shiny Pokémon*
One GO Snapshot surprise event encounter per day—Latias may appear on Saturday and Latios may appear on Sunday!

description: Flabébé will appear more frequently on Routes throughout the city during Pokémon GO Tour: Kalos – Global!
If you’re lucky, you might encounter Flabébé (White) and Flabébé (Orange), no matter what region you’re in.
Plus, you can collect Zygarde Cells and encounter Mateo at the end of up to 25 Routes per day!

regionalAppearances.region: Europe, the Middle East, and Africa

timedResearchRegions.region: In Europe, the Middle East, and Africa:

description: During Pokémon GO Tour: Kalos – Global, ticket-holding Trainers will be able to pick between two Special Research paths: X Version and Y Version. The path you pick will determine certain rewards and bonuses!

In this branching Special Research, you’ll choose to pursue either the X Version medal or the Y Version medal. Trainers who complete their event Special Research will receive an encounter with a Xerneas that has a Special Background inspired by Pokémon X or an Yveltal that has a Special Background inspired by Pokémon Y, depending on the path chosen!

To get the most out of these bonuses, be sure to start the An X-ceptional Yarn Special Research as soon as it becomes available. This Special Research will be available beginning on Saturday, February 28, 2026, at 10:00 a.m. local time.

Ticket-holding Trainers can choose between two Special Research paths: X Version or Y Version. Complete the An X-ceptional Yarn Special Research to receive an encounter with either Xerneas (X Version) or Yveltal (Y Version), each with a Special Background inspired by their respective games. The path you choose also determines which Unown (X or Y) you’ll encounter from Field Research tasks. This Special Research will be available beginning on Saturday, February 28, 2026, at 10:00 a.m. local time.

paths.name: X Version
details: Receive Xerneas-themed Special Research rewards, including an encounter with a Xerneas* that has a Special Background inspired by Pokémon X.
Chance to receive event-themed Field Research tasks that reward encounters with Unown X*.

paths.name: Y Version
details: Receive Yveltal-themed Special Research rewards, including an encounter with an Yveltal* that has a Special Background inspired by Pokémon Y.
Chance to receive event-themed Field Research tasks that reward encounters with Unown Y*.
*If you’re lucky, you may encounter a Shiny one!

Ticket-holding Trainers attending Pokémon GO Tour: Kalos – Tainan or Pokémon GO Tour: Kalos – Los Angeles can also take part in this branching Special Research, even if they’ve claimed the in-person event Special Research!

specialBackgrounds: Trainers who participate in raids during Pokémon GO Tour: Kalos – Global will have a chance of receiving new Special Backgrounds after making a successful catch. These souvenir backgrounds will appear on the Pokémon’s summary page, showing when the Pokémon was caught and commemorating your adventures during Pokémon GO Tour!
Pokémon GO Tour: Kalos – Global will feature three Special Backgrounds for you to collect—one inspired by Pokémon X, one inspired by Pokémon Y, and one inspired by Mega Evolution!
Pikachu wearing Calem’s hat, Pikachu wearing Serena’s hat, Honedge, and Xerneas can have a background inspired by Pokémon X.
Pikachu wearing Calem’s hat, Pikachu wearing Serena’s hat, Honedge, and Yveltal can have a background inspired by Pokémon Y.
All Pokémon caught from Mega Raids can have a background inspired by Mega Evolution.

name: Scorbunny Community Day
heading: Community Day

bonusDisclaimers: * While most bonuses are only active during the three hours of the event (2:00 p.m. to 5:00 p.m. local time), these bonuses will be active from 2:00 p.m. to 9:00 p.m. local time.
The three-hour Incense bonus excludes Daily Adventure Incense and the one-hour Lure bonus excludes Golden Lure Modules.
